page.title: 13TWO CHURCHES NEAR SHAWBURY
page.content: { ST.ANDREW'S CHURCH IN STANTON In the churchyard the biggest{grave belongs to the{Hayes}family.The oldest grave dates from the sixteenth century.Unusually,Stanton churchyard is round in shape. The church building is{Norman,}but part of the North wall may be Saxon. Inside the church there is a long, narrow nave and chancel.The organ is the most costly item there.The church has six bells in the{tower.}The stone is red & white from{Grinshill Quarry. { { ST. BARTHOLOMEW'S,MORETON CORBET The church was built in the{year{1200 {A.D.}In the churchyard is the statue of a boy marking the grave of Vincent Corbet.Inside the church are two box tombs with figures on the top. Around the walls are{stones tablets}in memery of members of the Corbet family.
